subject: Re: [junit] Re: Use of JExample for maintaining order of execution 	for tests
msgSnippet: I m not sure I can recommend a particular policy.  If your extension starts generating a lot of discussion, it may serve both the extension s users and the
messageBody:
I'm not sure I can recommend a particular policy. If your extension
starts generating a lot of discussion, it may serve both the
extension's users and the more general JUnit community to provide an
easy way of opting-in to just one of the two discussions. That said,
I'd always welcome announcements of new or significantly-improved
extensions on this list.

Which is to say, I hope my message didn't read as "go ask somewhere
else, you're not welcome here", but just as "gee, don't know, have you
tried this other approach?"

David Saff

On Fri, Jan 22, 2010 at 8:08 PM, adrian.kuhn <akuhn@...> wrote:
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>>
>> I assume there are forums for getting JExample-specific help, and
>> people there might have a better idea?
>
> The fastest way for JExample feedback is to tweet @jexample or to email me. There is no dedicated JExample mailing list.
>
> BTW, what is the policy regarding discussions of JUnit extensions on this list? I can see both arguments in favor of keeping the community together and in favor of keeping focused on the core.
>
> cheers,
> AA
>
